snippet: After projecting a relatively easy victory for Hillary Clinton with all the certainty of a calculus solution, major outlets scrambled to provide candid answers....
abstract: Jim Rutenberg Mediator column examines why major news organization in United States were so wrong in their predictions about outcome of presidential election; notes there is widespread feeling that coastal and Beltway news organizations had difficulty understanding depth and range of anger and resentment of Donald Trump's core voters.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Sydney Ember, John Koblin, Michael Grynbaum and Alexandra Alter.

lead_paragraph: After projecting a relatively easy victory for Hillary Clinton with all the certainty of a calculus solution, major outlets scrambled to provide candid answers.

headline.print_headline: News Outlets  Wonder Where  They Stumbled
headline.main: News Outlets Wonder Where the Predictions Went Wrong
